thread.title: The Sunday Telegraph babies of the week | The

title: The Sunday Telegraph babies of the week | The
text:
JAKE MICHAEL HORE
Born: September 6, 2014 at Westmead Hospital
Weight: 3.525kg
LANSVALE newlyweds Clare and Rick Hore welcomed their first baby into the world exactly nine months after their honeymoon in beautiful Fiji.
After an enjoyable pregnancy, their regularly hiccupping “Bula-baby’’ was born.
At six weeks, Jake was baptised in his late great-grandfather Michael McKeown’s christening gown, which he had worn in 1918 when he was baptised, and which was worn by his mother in 1980.
“Jake’s a very happy cuddly baby who is often cackling and laughing,” Clare says.
“He is always greeting his Mum with an amused laugh each morning and kicking his legs in excitement when she opens his blinds. He is truly a little boy who enjoys a good tickle, a boisterous game of peek-a-boo and galloping around the house, laughing with Daddy.”
Jake is a very happy baby, his mum Clare says. Source: News Corp Australia
A greenie at heart, Jake loves nature and the great Australian outdoors like his mum, Clare says.
“He is constantly checking out his surroundings and being quite the little stickybeak,” she says.
“On their weekday visits, Jake loves baby chatting and ninja-rolling around his 90-year-old great-grandmother Kathleen’s home — he gets plenty of attention for his big eyes and long eyelashes and from mimicking people and fake-laughing.”
Credit: Jonathan David Photography
MORE BABIES:
SMALL BABY WITH THE BIG NAME
BABY ANGELINA BRINGS JOY TO FAMILY
EVERY week, The Sunday Telegraph celebrates new births in its babies of the week section. To feature your child, email babies@news.com.au with a JPEG picture of your baby and include your contact details.
Charlotte Plakidis
Born: April 22, 2015 at Sutherland Hospital
Weight: 3.7kg
CHARLOTTE’S favourite thing to do is to listen to her mum sing while she bounces her.
She is the first born to her parents Ashley and Andrew who adore her and can’t wait to watch their princess grow.
Charlotte is her parents’ little princess. Source: Supplied
Sophie Hogarth
Born: May 26, 2014 at Royal Hospital For Women, Randwick
Weight: 4.08kg
SOPHIE had a gentle soul and loves lots of cuddles.
She enjoys spending time with her siblings Riley, 7, and Olivia, 2.
Her favourite food is scrambled eggs, which she wishes she could eat every day.
Sophie Hogarth enjoys some cake. Source: Supplied
Mack Ernie Reynolds
Born: February 13, 2015 at Hawkesbury Hospital
Weight: 3.37kg
MACK is a very happy and cheeky little boy who loves smiling, giggling and having a chat to anyone who will listen. He enjoys having baths and lots of cuddles with big brother Jagger, 2.
Kai Crisafulli loves playing music. Source: Supplied
Mack Reynolds loves bath time. Source: Supplied
Kai Xavier Crisafulli
Born: October 8, 2014 at Kareena Private Hospital
Weight: 3.21kg
KAI is a musician in the making, who enjoys playing all the instruments at playgroup.
He likes to practice splashing in the bath and soaks his parents every time. He’s a huge fan of his dad’s soccer team.
Lucas Michael Campbell
Born: October 4, 2014 at Nepean Hospital
Weight: 2.97kg
LUCAS is a very curious, mischievous baby who gets into anything and everything.
He has two siblings Jaydon and Mariah who adore him. Lucas is forever trying to get involved in what they are up to.
Nevaeh Hewson. Source: Supplied
Lucas Campbell. Source: Supplied
Nevaeh Jade Hewson
Born: August 20, 2014 at Sutherland Hospital
Weight: 2.8kg
LITTLE Nevaeh loves to be around her family and has a cheeky personality.
She enjoys listening to music and her favourite song is Shake it Off by Taylor Swift. Her infectious smile can light up anyone’s day.
Originally published as Honeymoon baby a joy for first-time parents
